trans-unit.source: What is Azure Automation
trans-unit.target: What is Azure Automation

trans-unit.source: Learn what value Azure Automation provides and get answers to common questions so that you can get started in creating and using runbooks.
trans-unit.target: Learn what value Azure Automation provides and get answers to common questions so that you can get started in creating and using runbooks.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Automation provides a way for users to automate the manual, long-running, error-prone, and frequently repeated tasks that are commonly performed in a cloud and enterprise environment.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Automation provides a way for users to automate the manual, long-running, error-prone, and frequently repeated tasks that are commonly performed in a cloud and enterprise environment.

trans-unit.source: This article provides brief answers to common questions about Azure Automation.
trans-unit.target: This article provides brief answers to common questions about Azure Automation.

trans-unit.source: You can refer to other articles in this library for more detailed information on the different topics.
trans-unit.target: You can refer to other articles in this library for more detailed information on the different topics.

trans-unit.source: Azure Automation saves time and increases the reliability of the regular administrative tasks that you perform in cloud and enterprise environments.
trans-unit.target: Azure Automation saves time and increases the reliability of the regular administrative tasks that you perform in cloud and enterprise environments.

trans-unit.source: You can implement these processes as runbooks which can perform multiple tasks with no human intervention and even schedule them to be automatically performed at regular intervals.
trans-unit.target: You can implement these processes as runbooks which can perform multiple tasks with no human intervention and even schedule them to be automatically performed at regular intervals.

trans-unit.source: A runbook is a set of tasks that perform some automated process in Azure Automation.
trans-unit.target: A runbook is a set of tasks that perform some automated process in Azure Automation.

trans-unit.source: It may be a simple process such as starting a virtual machine or creating a log entry, or you may have a complex runbook that combines other smaller runbooks to perform a complex process across multiple resources or even multiple clouds.
trans-unit.target: It may be a simple process such as starting a virtual machine or creating a log entry, or you may have a complex runbook that combines other smaller runbooks to perform a complex process across multiple resources or even multiple clouds.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might have an existing manual process for provisioning a new virtual machine that includes multiple steps such as creating the virtual machine, connecting it to a network, assigning it an IP address, and then notifying a user that it's ready.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might have an existing manual process for provisioning a new virtual machine that includes multiple steps such as creating the virtual machine, connecting it to a network, assigning it an IP address, and then notifying a user that it's ready.

trans-unit.source: Instead of manually performing each of these steps, you could create a runbook that would perform all of these tasks as a single process.
trans-unit.target: Instead of manually performing each of these steps, you could create a runbook that would perform all of these tasks as a single process.

trans-unit.source: You would start the runbook, provide the required information such as the virtual machine name, IP address, and recipient e-mail and then sit back while the process completes without you.
trans-unit.target: You would start the runbook, provide the required information such as the virtual machine name, IP address, and recipient e-mail and then sit back while the process completes without you.

trans-unit.source: Runbooks in Azure Automation are based on PowerShell Workflow, so they do anything that PowerShell can do.
trans-unit.target: Runbooks in Azure Automation are based on PowerShell Workflow, so they do anything that PowerShell can do.

trans-unit.source: If an application or service has an API, then a runbook can work with it.
trans-unit.target: If an application or service has an API, then a runbook can work with it.

trans-unit.source: If you have a PowerShell module for it, then you can load that module into Azure Automation and include those cmdlets in your runbook.
trans-unit.target: If you have a PowerShell module for it, then you can load that module into Azure Automation and include those cmdlets in your runbook.

trans-unit.source: Azure Automation runbooks run in the Azure cloud so that can access any resources in the cloud or external resources that can be accessed from the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Azure Automation runbooks run in the Azure cloud so that can access any resources in the cloud or external resources that can be accessed from the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Using <linkText>Hybrid Runbook Worker</linkText><title></title>, runbooks can run in your local data center to manage local resources.
trans-unit.target: Using <linkText>Hybrid Runbook Worker</linkText><title></title>, runbooks can run in your local data center to manage local resources.

trans-unit.source: The <linkText>Runbook Gallery</linkText><title></title> contains runbooks from Microsoft and the community that you can either use unchanged in your environment or customize them for your own purposes.
trans-unit.target: The <linkText>Runbook Gallery</linkText><title></title> contains runbooks from Microsoft and the community that you can either use unchanged in your environment or customize them for your own purposes.

trans-unit.source: They are also useful to as references to learn how to create your own runbooks.
trans-unit.target: They are also useful to as references to learn how to create your own runbooks.

trans-unit.source: You can even contribute your own runbooks to the gallery that you think other users may find useful.
trans-unit.target: You can even contribute your own runbooks to the gallery that you think other users may find useful.

trans-unit.source: You can <linkText>create your own runbooks</linkText><title></title> from scratch or modify runbooks from the <linkText>Runbook Gallery</linkText><title></title> for your own requirements.
trans-unit.target: You can <linkText>create your own runbooks</linkText><title></title> from scratch or modify runbooks from the <linkText>Runbook Gallery</linkText><title></title> for your own requirements.

trans-unit.source: If you prefer to work directly with the PowerShell code, you can <linkText>edit the runbook using the textual editor</linkText><title></title> in the Azure portal or edit if offline.
trans-unit.target: If you prefer to work directly with the PowerShell code, you can <linkText>edit the runbook using the textual editor</linkText><title></title> in the Azure portal or edit if offline.

trans-unit.source: If you prefer to edit a runbook without being exposed to the underlying code, then you can use the <linkText>graphical editor</linkText><title></title> in the Azure preview portal.
trans-unit.target: If you prefer to edit a runbook without being exposed to the underlying code, then you can use the <linkText>graphical editor</linkText><title></title> in the Azure preview portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Service Management Automation (SMA)</linkText><title></title> is intended to automate management tasks in the private cloud.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Service Management Automation (SMA)</linkText><title></title> is intended to automate management tasks in the private cloud.

trans-unit.source: It is installed locally in your data center as a component of <linkText>Windows Azure Pack</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: It is installed locally in your data center as a component of <linkText>Windows Azure Pack</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: SMA and Azure Automation use the same runbook format based on Windows PowerShell Workflow, but SMA does not support <linkText>graphical runbooks</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: SMA and Azure Automation use the same runbook format based on Windows PowerShell Workflow, but SMA does not support <linkText>graphical runbooks</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>System Center 2012 Orchestrator</linkText><title></title> is intended for automation of on-premises resources.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>System Center 2012 Orchestrator</linkText><title></title> is intended for automation of on-premises resources.

trans-unit.source: It uses a different runbook format than Azure Automation and Service Management Automation and has a graphical interface to create runbooks without requiring any scripting.
trans-unit.target: It uses a different runbook format than Azure Automation and Service Management Automation and has a graphical interface to create runbooks without requiring any scripting.

trans-unit.source: Its runbooks are composed of activities from Integration Packs that are written specifically for Orchestrator.
trans-unit.target: Its runbooks are composed of activities from Integration Packs that are written specifically for Orchestrator.

trans-unit.source: A variety of resources are available for you to learn more about Azure Automation and creating your own runbooks.
trans-unit.target: A variety of resources are available for you to learn more about Azure Automation and creating your own runbooks.

trans-unit.source: Azure Automation Library is where you are right now.
trans-unit.target: Azure Automation Library is where you are right now.

trans-unit.source: The articles in this library provide complete documentation on the configuration and administration of Azure Automation and for authoring your own runbooks.
trans-unit.target: The articles in this library provide complete documentation on the configuration and administration of Azure Automation and for authoring your own runbooks.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure PowerShell cmdlets</linkText><title></title> provides information for automating Azure operations using Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure PowerShell cmdlets</linkText><title></title> provides information for automating Azure operations using Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Runbooks use these cmdlets to work with Azure resources.
trans-unit.target: Runbooks use these cmdlets to work with Azure resources.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Automation Blog</linkText><title></title> provides the latest information on Azure Automation from Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Automation Blog</linkText><title></title> provides the latest information on Azure Automation from Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: You should subscribe to this blog to stay up to date with the latest from the Azure Automation team.
trans-unit.target: You should subscribe to this blog to stay up to date with the latest from the Azure Automation team.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Automation Forum</linkText><title></title> allows you to post questions about Azure Automation to be addressed by Microsoft and the Automation community.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Automation Forum</linkText><title></title> allows you to post questions about Azure Automation to be addressed by Microsoft and the Automation community.

trans-unit.source: Please give us feedback! If you are looking for an Azure Automation runbook solution or an integration module, post a Script Request on Script Center.
trans-unit.target: Please give us feedback! If you are looking for an Azure Automation runbook solution or an integration module, post a Script Request on Script Center.

trans-unit.source: If you have feedback or feature requests for Azure Automation, post them on <linkText>User Voice</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you have feedback or feature requests for Azure Automation, post them on <linkText>User Voice</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Thanks!
trans-unit.target: Thanks!
